alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 05 at 12:21PM EST until January 09 at 2:38AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Bibb, Jones, Monroe, Twiggs and Houston Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Macon, Dames Ferry, Macon, Byron, Hawkinsville, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Minor flooding expands. An increasing amount of the Macon GreenWay Ocmulgee Heritage Trail floods north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge. The flood waters will be up to two feet deep on portions of the trail and both banks overflow upstream from the bridge. Large portions of agricultural lands east of Macon and well downstream will be under 1 to 4 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 19.1 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.3 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 18 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
